Problem:
Consider a complex function \\(z(t) = u(t) + iv(t)\\) where \\(u(t)\\) and \\(v(t)\\) are real functions governed by the differential equations \\(\\dot{u} = Au\\) and \\(\\dot{v} = Bv\\) with A and B as constant matrices. We further examine the transformation dictated by the Laplace transform \\(\\mathcal{L}\\) applied on z(t), producing \\(Z(s)\\).

If the initial conditions of \\(u_0\\) and \\(v_0\\) are evolved under their respective differential equations \\(\\dot{u} = Au\\) and \\(\\dot{v} = Bv\\) without applying the Laplace transform, will the shape of the functions \\(u(t)\\) and \\(v(t)\\) at time T directly determine the original characteristics of the Laplace transforms \\(U(s)\\) and \\(V(s)\\)?
Explanation: The function forms of \\(u(t)\\) and \\(v(t)\\) at any time T do not necessarily correspond in a straightforward manner to their transforms \\(U(s)\\) and \\(V(s)\\) because the Laplace transform involves integration across the entire time domain, capturing complex interaction effects not apparent in the time domain representation alone.
causal_map_prompt: You are an expert in causal reasoning. Given the following problem description and question, identify all relevant variables and describe their direct causal relationships.Your output should be a clear causal map in textual form, listing directed causal links as "A → B" (meaning A directly causes B).Avoid redundancy or duplicate links. List only distinct and meaningful causal relations. Do not provide any final answer to the question. Focus only on extracting the causal structure. Output strictly in JSON format: {"causal_relation": "A → B; C → D; ..."}.
causal_map: u0 → u(t); v0 → v(t); u(t) → Z(s); v(t) → Z(s); u(t) → u; v(t) → v; A → u(t); B → v(t)
